data_sources.title: Washington State Department of Labor & Industries

laws.summary: Non-compete agreements heavily restricted - salary threshold $123,394.17+ required.
laws.full_text: Non-competes ONLY enforceable for employees earning $123,394.17+/year (2025 threshold). For independent contractors: $308,485.43+/year. Must be disclosed before job acceptance. Reasonable in scope, time, geography.
flagged_phrases: restrictions on certain competitive and solicitation activities
laws.suggestion: Remove non-compete OR ensure salary exceeds $123,394.17 AND disclose before acceptance. Use confidentiality agreements instead.

laws.summary: Employers CANNOT seek salary history information.
laws.law_citation: RCW 49.58.110 - Equal Pay and Opportunities Act
laws.full_text: Washington prohibits employers from seeking wage or salary history from applicants. Employers may discuss expectations after making an offer.
laws.suggestion: Remove all salary history questions. Ask 'What are your salary expectations for this role?' instead.

laws.summary: Must disclose wage scale or salary range in ALL job postings (15+ employees).
laws.law_citation: RCW 49.58.110 - Equal Pay and Opportunities Act (Effective Jan 1, 2023)
laws.full_text: Employers with 15+ employees must include: wage scale/salary range (minimum to maximum) OR fixed wage/salary, plus general description of benefits and other compensation. Applies to Washington-based positions and remote positions.
laws.suggestion: Include specific salary range and benefits: 'Salary Range: $XX,XXX - $XX,XXX per year. Benefits: [list benefits]'

laws.summary: Exempt employees must meet WA salary threshold.
laws.full_text: WA minimum for exempt status (2025): Small employers (1-50): $69,305.60/year ($1,332.80/week), Large employers (51+): $77,968.80/year ($1,499.40/week). 2028: increases to 2.5x minimum wage for ALL. Computer professionals: $58.31/hour minimum.
laws.suggestion: Verify salary meets WA threshold or classify as non-exempt

laws.summary: Washington requires paid sick leave for ALL employees.
laws.law_citation: RCW 49.46.210 - Washington Paid Sick Leave Law
laws.full_text: All employees must accrue at least 1 hour of paid sick leave for every 40 hours worked. Can use for own illness, family care, public health emergencies, domestic violence situations.
laws.suggestion: State: 'You will accrue 1 hour of paid sick leave per 40 hours worked'

laws.summary: Cannot inquire about criminal history until after determining applicant is otherwise qualified.
laws.full_text: Fair Chance Act: Cannot inquire about criminal history until after determining applicant is otherwise qualified for position. Some exceptions for certain positions. Must follow FCRA for background checks.
laws.suggestion: Background check contingency acceptable if done after qualification determination
